availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky, school teacher. Kentucky native. Married to Frances A. Bell Gatewood in Trimble County on July 19, 1835. Father of Martha B. Gatewood. Mary E. Gatewood, Pulaski B. Gatewood, Silas Gatewood, Jr., and Fanny Omega Gatewood. Appointed Postmaster in Bedford, Trimble County in 1834. School teacher in Trimble County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Trimble County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, Bedford, p. 63.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 6.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trimble County Marriages, Film #000482445, p. 226.
Federal Mortality Census Schedules, 1850-1880, and Related Indexes, 1850-1880, Collection T655, Archive Roll Number 20, 1880, Milton, Trimble, Kentucky.
